sen.e: "Tamonin Nikki" (Tamonin Diary), written in Tamonin tacchu (a tacchu is a sub-temple on the site of a main temple) of Kofuku-ji Temple, Nara, was kept for 140 years (from 1478 to 1618) by three generations of authors, including the monk Eishun.
